parse_class module¶

class parse_class.param_matcher(list_str)¶

Bases: object

This class is the node of a tree. Each node stores textual content and pointers to it’s children.

children(str_curr)¶

Populate the children of current node

str_curr: String the current string
string: the list of locations in the str_curr to have nested blocks
html_print(file_name='')¶

This function prints a html table of all the fetched articles. The columns of the tables are Title, Title Description, URL of the article, Image URL respectively.

file_name (Optional): String If file name is passed, then instead of stdout, print content in the file

None

parser_to_print()¶

This function prints the Title, Title Description, URL, Image Url separated by tab of news articles fetched.

None

None

populate_data()¶

This function parses the tree rooted at current node and stores all the articles which are the children of this node in a list

None

None

populate_sql(num, category, author, print_html=0)¶

This function populates the admin side SQL tables and also prints the new added articles if print_html argument passed is 1

num: Integer
This is the upper bound of number of articles to add in SQL tables. The articles added are minimum of articles fetched and num.
category: String
This is category of the fetched articles in the SQL table.
author: String
This is the name of the author who is adding the news articles.
print_html (Optional): Bool
This value specifies whether to print the html table of new added articles. If this argument is 1, then print the table, otherwise do not print the table.

None

pretty_print(file_name)¶

Print pretty the textual contents as well as the brackets in nested order.

file_name: String the file name to write the pretty values
string: the string which is the pretty print in the file
rem_brackets(file_name)¶

Print pretty only the brackets in nested order.

file_name: String the file name to write the pretty values
string: the string which is the pretty print in the file
